Hello, I have the same problem with apache 1.3.27 + mod_ssl on Solaris 8 Sparc.

I figured out that apache crashes on directory listing only when there are files
with spaces in filename in the directory. If I move away those files all works fine.

This is a piece of my error log:

[Sun Mar 30 13:44:28 2003] [notice] child pid 22130 exit signal Bus Error (10)
[Sun Mar 30 13:44:35 2003] [notice] child pid 22127 exit signal Bus Error (10)
[Sun Mar 30 13:44:35 2003] [notice] child pid 22131 exit signal Bus Error (10)
[Sun Mar 30 13:44:36 2003] [notice] child pid 22159 exit signal Bus Error (10)

creator: maxik@maxik.spb.ru
text:
I am sorry, the previous post was not quite correct.

Detail investigation showed that this depends on file size.

If I create file with size 1048576 (which is 1024 * 1024) or less bytes all
works fine.
If I create file with size 1048577 (which is 1024 * 1024 + 1) or more bytes
directory listing crashes.

One more addition:

If I add

IndexOptions SuppressSize

directive all works fine no matter is FancyIndexing turned on or off.

:) That's workaround.
